meanings.definition: Analyzing something by breaking it down into its component parts.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys deconstructing complex problems to find solutions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often deconstruct data to better understand patterns.
meanings.sent3: The detective was deconstructing the crime scene to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: By deconstructing the recipe, she discovered the secret ingredient.
meanings.sent5: Deconstructing a puzzle can help you see how all the pieces fit together.

meanings.definition: Critically examining a text or idea to reveal underlying assumptions.
meanings.sent1: He is deconstructing the novel to uncover its hidden meanings.
meanings.sent2: Literary analysts often deconstruct poems to explore symbolism.
meanings.sent3: The students were deconstructing the Shakespeare play in class.
meanings.sent4: By deconstructing the argument, she found flaws in the logic.
meanings.sent5: Deconstructing a theory can lead to new insights and perspectives.

meanings.definition: Taking apart a structure or system to understand its elements.
meanings.sent1: The engineer is deconstructing the machine to study its components.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists deconstruct ancient ruins to learn about past civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The children were deconstructing the toy to see how it works.
meanings.sent4: By deconstructing the model, she identified areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: Deconstructing a building can reveal its architectural secrets.
